sentence.Network_cn: 我请每位市民都仔细研读该文件。

sentence.Network_en: "Look," she said, getting a brainstorm, "Why don't you invite them here?"
sentence.Network_cn: “对了，”她灵机一动说道，“你干吗不请他们到这儿来？”

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Old French inviter, or from Latin invitare

entry.def: If you invite someone to something such as a party or a meal, you ask them to come to it.

example.ex: She invited him to her 26th birthday party in New Jersey...
example.tran: 她邀请他去参加她在新泽西举行的 26 岁生日聚会。

example.ex: I invited her in for a coffee...

entry.def: If you are invited to do something, you are formally asked or given permission to do it.

example.ex: At a future date, managers will be invited to apply for a management buy-out...
example.tran: 在将来的某天,经理们将受邀进行管理层收购。

example.ex: The person concerned would be shown the evidence in private and invited to stand down...
example.tran: 将会向有关人员私下出示该证据,并要求其暂时离开证人席。

entry.def: If something you say or do invites trouble or criticism, it makes trouble or criticism more likely.

example.ex: I realise that an Englishman who generalises about Ireland invites trouble...
example.tran: 我意识到英国人如果对爱尔兰问题加以泛化的话会招惹麻烦。

example.ex: Their refusal to compromise will inevitably invite more criticism from the UN.
example.tran: 他们拒绝妥协必然会引发联合国的更多批评。

entry.def: An invite is an invitation to something such as a party or a meal.

example.ex: They haven't got an invite to the wedding.
example.tran: 他们还没收到参加婚礼的请柬。

sentences.sentence: "he didn't get no invite to the party"
"Can I invite you for dinner on Sunday night?"

means.word_mean: 3. give rise to a desire by being attractive or inviting;
4. ask someone in a friendly way to do something

sentences.sentence: "We invited the neighbors in for a cup of coffee"

means.word_mean: 7. request the participation or presence of;

sentences.sentence: "The organizers invite submissions of papers for the conference"

means.word_mean: 8. express willingness to have in one's home or environs;

auth_sentence.content: To even approach this subject is to invite reproach.
auth_sentence.res_content: To even approach this subject is to invite reproach.

Sentence.sentence: Today's presentation will show how we see the development of the motor car in the short to medium term, and that is why we have invited all of you here today.
She was invited to work as an English teacher.
He seldom invites people to his home.
Another question invites them to write about the importance (to them, agai of diversity―a word that has assumed magic power in American higher education.
Tony's mother has invited me to dinner.

sentences.en: They invited me to visit their factory.
sentences.cn: 他们邀我去参观他们的工厂。

sentences.en: She invited our opinion of her story.
sentences.cn: 她征求我们对她的故事的意见。

sentences.en: After his lecture, he invited questions.
sentences.cn: 课后, 他请同学们提问。

sentences.en: The audience is invited to ask questions at the end.

means.word_mean: 引诱, 怂恿; 招致

sentences.en: The calm water in the lake invited us to swim.
sentences.cn: 平静的湖水引起我们去游泳的兴趣。

sentences.en: Don't leave the windows open—it's inviting thieves to enter.
sentences.cn: 别让窗户那么开着, 会招来小偷的。

jushi.english: They were afraid that such a move would only invite trouble.
jushi.chinese: 他们担心这样的行动只会引起麻烦。

jushi.english: Why did you invite them here?
jushi.chinese: 你为什么邀请他们到这儿来?

jushi.english: The new hotel invites suggestions from the guests.
jushi.chinese: 这家新开张的旅馆向客人征求建议。
